target.name: Chapter
target.text: Installing Novell Teaming

target.name: Sect1
target.text: Running the Installer

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Run the installer (on Linux, do a chmod +x installer-liferay.linux to make the installer executable).

target.name: Step
target.text: Run the installer (on Linux, do a chmod +x installer-liferay.linux to make the installer executable).

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Welcome window, select the procedure you want to perform, then click Next:

target.name: Step
target.text: Read the license agreement, select the I accept the license agreement option to indicate your acceptance of this agreement, then click Next.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Choose installation type window, select the type of installation you want to perform, then click Next:

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Install location window, use the associated Browse buttons to change the default location for the installation or file system:

target.name: Step
target.text: If you need to change the locations of any of the file system components, select advanced from the File system setup type drop-down list to activate the Browse buttons for these components, make the necessary changes, then click Next.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Liferay data location window, click Browse if you need to change the default Root location for this data, then click Next.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Network information window, specify the network values for how you want Novell Teaming to appear on the network. See "Network Planning" on page 14.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Database selection window, configure your databases and select whether or not to create the databases during install. The database server you select must already be installed.

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Select the database from the Database type drop-down list.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the database from the Database type drop-down list.

target.name: Step
target.text: Enter your Username, Password, and JDBC URL for the icecore and Liferay databases, then click Next.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Java JDK location window, click Browse to select the Java Home directory location (if not detected automatically), type in the JVM heap size value if you require more than the default 1 G (use a small "g" with no spaces), then click Next.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Lucene configuration window, edit the fields to configure the Lucene index.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the RSS configuration window, edit the fields to configure the Novell Teaming RSS feeds, or deselect the Enable RSS option to disable RSS feeds, then click Next.

target.name: FormalPara
target.text: RSS feed URLs:

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Outbound email configuration window, edit the fields to configure your outbound e-mail settings. Outbound configuration requires the basic information for generating SMTP mail messages: server, port, and optional authentication information.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Inbound email configuration window, edit the following fields to configure your inbound e-mail settings, then click Next.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Presence configuration window, select the Enable presence option to link your Novell Teaming and Conferencing servers together. You need to obtain the values for the following fields from an installed and configured Conferencing server. If you do not know these values now, you can run the installer's Reconfigure option to add this information later. Click Next to continue.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the iChain configuration window, select Enable iChain to use the iChain Single Sign-on Support (SSO), set the Logoff URL to the address used to trigger an iChain logoff, set the IP address of the iChain Proxy server.

target.name: Step
target.text: Mirrored folders are local/shared directories that are exposed within Novell Teaming. You must configure the directories here before they are available in Novell Teaming. For security reasons the set of people who can map Novell Teaming folders to these shared directories should be limited.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Ready to install window, click Next to begin the installation or use the Back button to review the current configuration of the installer.

target.name: Sect1
target.text: Installing a Standalone Lucene Index Server

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Copy the Lucene installer to the system on which you want to install the standalone Lucene Index Server.

target.name: Step
target.text: Copy the Lucene installer to the system on which you want to install the standalone Lucene Index Server.

target.name: Step
target.text: Run the Lucene installer.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Welcome window, select the procedure you want to perform, then click Next:

target.name: Step
target.text: Read the license agreement, select the I accept the license agreement option to indicate your acceptance of this agreement, then click Next.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Install location window, click Browse if you need to change the default Install location for the luceneserver, then click Next.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Lucene configuration window, edit the fields to configure the Lucene index.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Ready to install window, click Next to begin the installation or use the Back button to review the current configuration of the installer.

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Shut down Novell Teaming on the Novell Teaming server (see "Starting and Stopping Novell Teaming" on page 34).

target.name: Step
target.text: Shut down Novell Teaming on the Novell Teaming server (see "Starting and Stopping Novell Teaming" on page 34).

target.name: Step
target.text: Run the Lucene installer (see above procedure).

target.name: Step
target.text: On the standalone server, check the lucene-server.properties file and find the setting for index.root.dir (you can edit this setting to change the location of the root directory).

target.name: Step
target.text: Create a liferay.com subdirectory in the index.root.dir directory.

target.name: Step
target.text: On the Novell Teaming server, look at the ssf.properties file and find the data.root.dir setting.

target.name: Step
target.text: Copy all the files from the data.root.dir/lucene/liferay.com directory on the Novell Teaming server to the index.root.dir/liferay.com directory you just created on the standalone machine.

target.name: Step
target.text: For UNIX systems, make sure permissions are set so that the Novell Teaming user has full access to these files and the liferay.com directory.

target.name: Step
target.text: Start the server at the end of the installation (if it is not already started):

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Change directories to lucene-server-installation-dir

target.name: Step
target.text: Change directories to lucene-server-installation-dir

target.name: Step
target.text: Run the rmiregistry-startup script in the bin directory

target.name: Step
target.text: Run the indexserver-startup script in the bin directory

target.name: Step
target.text: Restart Novell Teaming (see "Starting and Stopping Novell Teaming" on page 34).

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Enter C:\yourinstall\liferay-portal-tomcat-5.5-jdk5-4.3.0\bin\service.bat install icecore

target.name: Step
target.text: Enter C:\yourinstall\liferay-portal-tomcat-5.5-jdk5-4.3.0\bin\service.bat install icecore

target.name: Step
target.text: Use the Services Control Panel to configure the service to your needs.

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Select Control Panel > Administration Tools > Services.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Control Panel > Administration Tools > Services.

target.name: Step
target.text: Right-click the ApacheTomcat icecore service and select Properties.

target.name: Step
target.text: Change the Startup Type to Automatic and click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Set your firewall to allow port 8080.

target.name: Procedure

target.name: Step
